intro: Hieracium idiogenes, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a single head, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium idiogenes is often found in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
